decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of counter spells, removal, and disruption to control the game while slowly building up card advantage and threats. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Counterspell, while efficiently dealing with threats using Fatal Push and Dismember. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Preordain and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, along with powerful finishers like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through a balance of control and threats.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to repeatedly mill cards from the library and generate infinite mana. It aims to win the game by casting Malevolent Rumble or Grapeshot for lethal damage, or by using Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to draw from an empty library to win. The deck also has cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mishra's Bauble to help with card selection and acceleration, making it a fast and efficient combo deck in the Modern format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and putting pressure on the opponent through a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan and Ranger-Captain of Eos, as well as burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge. The deck also utilizes sacrifice effects with cards like Goblin Bombardment to keep the opponent's board clear. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Guide of Souls and March of Otherworldly Light provide additional value and protection for the creatures in the deck. Overall, this deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach with Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to create a powerful combo that allows for repeated triggering of Grinding Station's ability to mill the opponent's deck. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mishra's Bauble provide card draw and selection, while Mox Opal and Mox Amber help ramp up mana quickly. Thassa's Oracle serves as a win condition by allowing the player to win the game if there are no cards left in their library. The deck aims to outpace opponents and win through a powerful and efficient combo finish.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and synergies within the Affinity archetype to overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays and disruptive interactions. By ramping up quickly with cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, while also disrupting the opponent's strategies with cards like Dispatch and Portable Hole, the deck aims to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game. With a mix of card draw, removal, and threats like Emry, Lurker of the Loch, the deck is designed to be fast-paced and versatile in its approach to winning matches.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful synergy between Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly ramp up mana and search for key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Tolaria West. The combination of bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber and utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures allows for explosive plays and the potential to quickly assemble a game-winning combo with cards like Scapeshift. The inclusion of cards like Aftermath Analyst and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove further enhance the deck's consistency and ability to execute its combo strategy.

The deck focuses on generating infinite milling and mana with the combination of Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Underworld Breach, and Grinding Station. By continuously sacrificing artifacts and casting cards from the graveyard, the deck aims to mill the opponent's deck completely or win with Grapeshot or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The use of Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal helps to ramp up quickly and achieve the combo as fast as possible. The deck also includes disruption cards like Pithing Needle and Lightning Bolt to control the opponent's strategy.

The deck aims to quickly set up a loop using Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to mill cards from the opponent's library and eventually win the game with Thassa's Oracle. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal provide mana acceleration and card advantage, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces. The deck also has disruptive elements in the form of counterspells like Swan Song and removal like Lightning Bolt. Additionally, it utilizes powerful land options such as Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble to further enhance the combo potential and consistency.

The deck revolves around quickly casting powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand by utilizing the combo potential of Allosaurus Rider and Chancellor of the Tangle. It aims to cheat these creatures into play using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution while also gaining life or protecting itself with cards like Nourishing Shoal and Pact of Negation. The deck also includes various tools for card selection and manipulation with Preordain and Abundant Harvest, as well as options for additional protection with Endurance and Noxious Revival.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and casting a high volume of spells to deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Desperate Ritual, Pyretic Ritual, and Manamorphose to ramp up mana production, while also including cards such as Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot to capitalize on casting a large number of spells in a single turn. The goal is to create a storm of spells that overwhelm the opponent and finish them off in a single explosive turn. The deck's main strategy is to create a powerful combo that can win the game in just a few turns.

Utilizing Eldrazi creatures and ramping up mana with artifacts, this deck aims to control the board and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats. By utilizing cards such as Mystic Forge and Devourer of Destiny, the deck can generate card advantage and mana acceleration, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Glaring Fleshraker. With a combination of efficient ramp and Eldrazi threats, this deck aims to outvalue opponents and establish dominance over the battlefield.

This deck focuses on aggressive early-game plays while also disrupting the opponent's game plan through taxing effects and graveyard hate. It utilizes powerful creatures like Emperor of Bones and Ketramose, the New Dawn to apply pressure, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude. The deck also has cards like Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategies and Thoughtseize for hand disruption. Flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp provide additional utility, allowing the deck to control the board and outvalue the opponent.

The deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with creatures, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once. This can overwhelm the opponent with a sudden surge of creatures, especially if they are unable to handle a large number of threats all at once. By utilizing cards like Bloodbraid Marauder and Incubation / Incongruity to cycle through the deck, the player can set up for a game-ending Living End combo. The deck also includes various support cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Endurance to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Control elements are included with cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan. Ugin's Labyrinth and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional control and utility. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big Eldrazi creatures while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing creatures with powerful abilities to apply pressure on the opponent. It includes a mix of disruptive spells and removal to control the board while also incorporating synergies between creatures for added value. The mana base is tailored to support the deck's aggressive gameplan, with a combination of lands and spells to ensure consistent early-game aggression. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently, punishing any missteps with its versatile toolkit of threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy lies in efficiently using Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to control the board, while utilizing cards like Territorial Kavu and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to deal direct damage. Additionally, Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide strong late-game threats. The deck also includes a mix of land cards to ensure mana consistency and support its aggressive game plan.
